title: James McKay / Creative Context
entityNote: James McKay, Creative Context, and Creative Context Studio are the same person/entity. Any query referencing these names should be treated as the same.

sections.content: James McKay operates professionally as Creative Context and Creative Context Studio — all three names refer to the same person and entity. Email: james@creativecontext.studio. Based in Atlanta, GA and Brooklyn, NY. Remote-first with full capability to produce globally. Does not require visa sponsorship. Available to start immediately.

Primary title: Video Creative Leader & Production Systems Strategist. Also: Producer & Creative Director, Creative Technologist & AI Systems Builder, Technical Producer. Core value: producer and creator building production systems that work at any scale, from boutique creative direction to distributed teams producing 100+ assets weekly. Combines 18+ years of traditional, brand, and broadcast experience with hands-on AI integration expertise. Bridges traditional production with emerging tech, creative with technical, strategy with execution, global operations with remote-first delivery.

Founded in 2009. Through Creative Context Studio, James has concepted, produced, and delivered video projects spanning brand campaigns, documentary content, narrative film, and emerging media for Fortune 500 clients (IBM, Adidas, JP Morgan Chase), major networks, and independent productions. Managed teams across 6 continents. Built production systems from scratch including AI-integrated content creation workflows. Notable: IBM Cyber Security Campaign (2018) exceeded engagement targets by 40%. Feature film 'netuser' (2020) starring Denis O'Hare won Best Film at LGBT Los Angeles Film Festival. Built performance video testing framework reducing iteration cycles by 60%. Established distributed production network enabling content creation from anywhere on Earth.

sections.content: Writes like someone allergic to bullshit. Strips out industry jargon, marketing speak, and corporate handbook phrases. Reserved enthusiasm — direct and economical with words. Skeptical of hype, especially around AI. Focuses on practical outcomes, not theoretical possibilities. Short clear sentences over long flowing ones. Content priorities: the story first, then the team, then problems and solutions, then technical details only if they matter. Names tools specifically (Claude, ChatGPT, ElevenLabs, HeyGen) rather than hiding behind 'AI-powered solutions'. Never uses: synergy, rockstar, passionate, innovative, revolutionary, game-changing.

Mission: building systems that help creatives spend more time making things. AI is a tool for removing friction, not a miracle cure. Starts with the actual problem, not the tool. Tests AI against real production requirements, not vendor promises. Builds decision frameworks for when to use AI vs. traditional methods. Credits expertise specifically, names roles and contributions. Trains teams practically without hype. Quality standards maintained regardless of tools used. On-time and on-budget delivery is non-negotiable. Explores emerging tech when it solves real problems — not bleeding-edge R&D, not avoiding innovation. Builds repeatable processes, not one-off experiments.
keyDetails: Help creatives spend more time making things
Start with the problem, not the tool
